com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget
Class WPPanorama

java.lang.Object
  android.view.ViewGroup
      com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget.ViewGroup
          com.tombarrasso.android.wp7ui.widget.WPPanorama

public class WPPanorama
extends ViewGroup

Panorama layout for Android that wraps screens so that they may be scrolled horizontally infinitely/ circularly. When a user scrolls past the last screen he will be brought to the first screen. This feature can be turned off using the method setEndless. This layout scrolls by factors of its own with getScreenWidth.

It is important to distinguish between screens and children. A child can be multiple screens if it spans more than one mScreenWidth (the width of this layout) but a screen can only correspond to one child.

Based on AOSP Workspace from iosched app. If you wish to is an Interpolator add one as the second parameter in the init method of mScroller Scroller.

Change log:
v1.0

  • Initial Release
v1.01
  • Fading in/ out on scroll.
  • Using API 7 2.1
v1.02
  • Fixed ArithmeticException in getCurrentScreen.
v1.03
  • Fixed issue with default endless scrolling.
  • Fixed Resources.NotFoundException by renaming setBackground methods to setPanoramicBackground.
v1.04
  • Better multitouch scrolling.

Since:
16-03-2012

focusableViewAvailable

public void focusableViewAvailable(View focused)
If one of our descendant views decides that it could be focused now, only pass that along if it's on the current screen. This happens when live folders requery, and if they're off screen, they end up calling requestFocus, which pulls it on screen.
